1673022e-bc5e-5244-960a-4474c54d48ac.title: distance between culvert wall and trench wall is between 0.5 - 1.0 x the overall height of the culvert.

22a6f86f-d0e1-5094-9164-619a3fdc5f62.title: Clearance from external faces of the pit to each face of the excavation to be not less than 400mm

10fb66cd-f844-5ecc-afb2-9e36b54ef55e.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure trench is excavated to prepare culvert foundation and specified depth of bedding.

36bdd09d-4200-5417-b883-654e48483784.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.15 Table 701.151 Cl. 705.05(b)

78f395fd-1107-5935-b385-e5e7cd8cc000.title: the width of trench at and below the level of the top of the pipe shall be such that the horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench is greater than >300mm, less than <600mmm.

2007bcbd-1e52-5bb8-961f-1d1932173411.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.16 Cl. 701.20(a)

062bee77-ecc9-5314-aab0-2db2f0a13b0b.title: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness.

354e2ac3-ec46-5412-b006-72466fdb824e.title: minimum 200mm for pipes with D ≥ 1500 mm

9c2a37ce-cac8-536f-bd24-1caae9442952.title: Acceptance Criteria: Bedding material shall be provided and placed for the full width of the trench. The compacted thickness of bedding material following any shaping necessary shall be:

e559d7a1-a60c-5a9c-bc0c-07b79af8896a.title: D' is the nominal pipe diameter or culvert width.

4977577a-5bb2-5e0d-ac7c-2f562302a044.title: Once culvert sections are in position, an additional layer of bedding material is placed to a height equal to 30% of the nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.

903cf725-4460-530c-97cc-6a790b39cc3a.title: Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.

bfe60ec3-7ecb-51b5-9ab1-29e89ecacbc5.title: Spacing of multiple rows of culverts to reflect Table 701.171.

55daf26a-e6ad-5534-a655-0abaae3d2bea.title: Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

0c1d7f87-ecbe-584f-9baa-0fb32e6eae60.title: The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding for the full length of each section. The compacted bedding shall be shaped to accommodate the joint collar and ensure that the pipe is supported along its full length.

2bcfa05c-d689-51b3-845b-3af3ff392463.title: Where applicable, the top of the pipe as marked shall be within five degrees of the vertical axis of the culvert.

41c433e8-3007-5e4e-b73e-8666f5ce35de.title: Multi‑row box culverts laid with sections in each row in contact with the sections in the adjacent rows.

3f907d36-7611-5ee0-b225-6332797ff326.title: Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

105ac6f0-b746-58df-949f-4d19a2f09857.title: Contact areas between the top and bottom sections mortared.

bd9375f6-3ed6-5588-a259-b0af3221ae9d.title: Consecutive sections of box culverts are firmly placed butted together. The top section matched to the bottom section and no lips over adjoining bottom sections.

a9fd6999-9444-5f0c-bbcf-d454f71ed818.title: When cutting culvert section to length or to create a penetration, cuts to be done by machine to achieve a clean vertical face.

1ee3c813-958e-50fa-8af1-abbb176f5e14.title: Any exposed reinforcement shall be coated with an approved epoxy treatment to prevent corrosion.

8c6fe6c5-066c-5436-8143-2473a199dcbd.title: Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

dffcb84d-e87f-519f-9098-886589114b62.title: (d) Departure from design grade of pipe runs +/-10mm in 10m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250

1424841f-531d-5350-a946-68b4476be8a8.title: (a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers +/-20mm

c7d74d69-ee8e-5616-b82e-88401fefdcaa.title: RRJs assembled and prepared in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.

efae8d45-46bf-5091-81de-b6dd3d7ad06c.title: (b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers +/-100mm

7c749712-7eae-5360-b8d6-52f78f550a82.title: (c) Invert leve of pipes at pits +/-50mm whilst maintaining required drainage grade.

f0daab41-fb61-5e17-a5ed-926e347f582f.title: Where the trench has been excavated from design subgrade level or above, the trench is backfilled to design subgrade level with selected backfill material, and above that level with appropriate pavement material.

16815c6b-b191-5cf0-8f45-fe670feb8bd7.title: Where the trench is excavated from below design subgrade level the trench is filled with selected backfill material.

40f200f1-7135-52a1-82b1-19662f47d39b.title: Acceptance Criteria: Culvert Under Area to be Paved:

8fe27fb0-caad-5414-9f80-876804f77ad4.title: The trench is backfilled with selected backfill material to a level 300mm above the top of the culvert and with ordinary backfill material above that level.

72db4ace-5b02-5440-a541-ef13b8edeb26.title: If backfilling to the required level, select backfill material is used.
